newsitem.title: USA: USAir says January load factor rose 3.6 pts.
newsitem.headline: USAir says January load factor rose 3.6 pts.

text.p: USAir Group Inc Tuesday said its January load factor rose 3.6 percentage points to 62.5 percent from 58.9 percent amid a still healthy economy and improved weather from a year ago.

It said revenue passenger miles rose 19.6 percent in scheduled service for January 1997 while passengers increased 12.9 percent, compared with 1996. Last year's traffic was adversely impacted by the blizzard of 1996.

Domestic traffic increased by 15.3 percent over 1996 while available seat miles were up by 9.3 percent. International traffic was up 105.2 percent while international ASMs increased 81.8 percent, reflecting continuing growth from new service to several European cities.
